title.narrative: Immediate Relief and Disaster Planning Following Tropical Depression Urduja

description.narrative: Reports from members of PKKK Biliran showed that most of their sources of livelihood were washed away by the heavy rains and landslides from tropical depression Urduja. These are where the progress was made recovering their livelihoods from the damaged caused by supertyphoon Haiyan. Tropical depression Urduja has washed away all the efforts that they have invested. Almost a month later, the women have expressed that their immediate needs are still food items like rice, canned goods or dried beans/fish, non-food items like sanitary napkins, soap, and underwear. This project will aim to: 1) provide relief to affected members of the priority areas in the municipalities of Biliran and Algeria; and 2) plan for the relief and identify lessons on how the local organizations prepared and responded.

participating-org.narrative: Pambansang Kongreso ng Kababaihan sa Kanayunan (PKKK)
